page.title: 06Community work, Manningtree
page.content: During the late 1970's and 1980's pupils of Manningtree School have built up a programme of work with the handicapped, the elderly and the very young which has been recognised by awards for community work by National Westminster Bank and the North East Thames Regional Health Authority. Groups of pupils have paid weekly visits to the physically handicapped residents of Jacques Hall (Bradfield) and the mentally handicapped of Brunswick House (Mistley), organising activities for these residents, taking them on outings paid for by fund raising events in the school. They have helped to break down some of the myths and fears that still tend to isolate the mentally handicapped, particularly, in the community by befriending the residents. By Mr.J.Bloom, Teacher
